title: [QUESTION] How to get bitmap cropped by any quadrangle
body: Hello. Is it possible to cut a bitmap fragment from the quadrangle, which is marked with four points? I create app which take a photo and then allow user to crop that image. But user can create a non rectangle shapes. I know i need to do a matrix transformation to return normal image but i don't know how to get specific part of bitmap to transform Can u help me? Thanks in advance for the answer.

comments.author: mattleibow
comments.body:
This is pretty easy to do, once you have the image and the path that you wish to crop, create a new surface, clip and draw.

I have an example app here:
https://github.com/mattleibow/SkiaSharpImageCropper/blob/master/ImageCropper/ImageCropper/MainPage.xaml.cs#L104

comments.author: ziriax
comments.body:
Do you also want to apply a perspective transformation to the cropped polygon, so that the polygon is transformed into a square?

If so, it seems SkiaSharp 1.68 is currently missing some Skia/C++ methods to create a perspective matrix that maps a quadrilateral to another quadrilateral, e.g. [the `setPolyToPoly` method](https://source.chromium.org/chromium/chromium/src/+/master:third_party/skia/src/core/SkMatrix.cpp;l=1417?q=setPolyToPoly)

If need that, you could convert [this C++ code](https://source.chromium.org/chromium/chromium/src/+/master:third_party/skia/src/core/SkMatrix.cpp;drc=da6ef73266f6110abc5e788457f0e8f9257dd5b6;l=1341?q=setPolyToPoly) to C# for now

comments.body:
Thank you for replies.
This is exactly what i was looking for. Works great!
